div1.p: Hench discusses the credit given to Finlay for his ideas.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, October 19, 1941
div1.opener:
Return to Gen. Kean
FROM GEN. J. R. KEAN
The
ROOSEVELT
PRIDE OF THE SOUTH
New Orleans Lauisiana, U_S_A_
Oct
Sunday 10/19/41
FAY M. THOMAS
EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT
AND
GENERAL MANAGER
My dear Gen. Kean,
div1.p:
Mrs. Hench & I flew here from Pensacola when I
gave a medical talk. Mrs. Agramonte had told
me they had given the Louisiana State University Medical
School all of Dr. Agramonte's books & many papers
which are now issued in the Agramonte Memorial
Library. I spent yesterday morning going over
them but found nothing happened as far as
solving some of our problems as concerned.
Here also are a box or two of pathological slides
from Agramonte's lab at Military Hosp # 1
with a section or two from the disputed case of
Private Smith.

I also visited Dr. Matas, the distinguished
old New Orleans surgeon, the only surviving
member of the Chaille' commission. He insisted
that Americans should give much more credit
to Finlay for his “IDEA”. He spoke very
highly of Finlay & regretted the “narrow partisanship”
which had permitted the exclusion of Finlay from
AC
K
the “greater glory due to all”. He had no new data for
me except that he was “sure” that when the
preliminary work of the commission failed ” it was
Agramonte who said (in effect) “We're not getting
anywhere along the line. Let's go & see the old
doctor (Finlay) & talk to him anyway.” I tried to
get proof that it was Agramonte who took Reed
? ASIDE but aside from insisting that he was sure he'd
seen that written in authentic sources & that it
was the logical thing to expect Agramonte, a fellow
Cuban, to go with Reed he could not help me.

I have just gotten a preliminary supply of 15
Hygeia reports. They really are very nice & the
annoying change in the size of the print etc
is not noticable in these reprints. I should have
the full supply next week & will send you
as many as you wish. We go home tomorrow.

closer.seg:
Matas was delighted with the painting.
He wants several to put in libraries &
schools here.
